title: Abhyanga
description: Full-body oil massage for detoxification and rejuvenation

content.overview: Abhyanga is a traditional Ayurvedic therapy involving a full-body massage with warm herbal oils to promote relaxation, improve circulation, and eliminate toxins.
content.procedure: Warm herbal oils are applied to the entire body using synchronized strokes by one or two therapists. The massage typically lasts 60 minutes and is followed by a steam bath to facilitate deeper absorption of the oils.

content.overview: Snehana is a preparatory procedure that involves internal or external application of oils/ghee to lubricate the body and prepare it for Panchakarma therapies.
content.procedure: Includes both internal consumption (Snehapana) of medicated ghee/oils and external oil applications. Duration varies based on individual constitution and treatment goals.

title: Swedana
description: Herbal steam therapy for toxin elimination

content.overview: Swedana is a specialized fomentation therapy that uses medicated steam to open channels (srotas) and facilitate toxin removal through sweating.
benefits: Relieves muscle stiffness and joint pain
content.procedure: After oil application, patient sits in a steam chamber with herbal decoctions. Steam is administered for 15-45 minutes based on constitution.

title: Nadi Sweda
description: Localized steam therapy with herbal decoctions

content.overview: A targeted fomentation therapy where herbal steam is directed to specific body parts using a specialized tube apparatus.
content.procedure: Herbal decoctions are boiled in a Nadi Sweda machine, and the steam is directed through a hose to affected areas while protecting other body parts with cloth.

title: Churna Pinda Sweda
description: Herbal powder bolus massage with steam

content.overview: A sudation therapy where heated herbal powder pouches are used to massage the body along with steam therapy.
content.procedure: Herbal powders are tied in cotton cloth boluses, heated, and used to massage the body while simultaneously applying steam therapy.

content.overview: A unique heat therapy using sand-filled cotton pouches to apply medicated heat to specific body parts.
content.procedure: Special sand is heated with herbal decoctions, filled into cotton pouches, and applied to affected areas with gentle pressure.

content.overview: A therapeutic procedure using heated medicinal leaves bundled in cloth to massage the body.
content.procedure: Medicinal leaves are heated with oils, wrapped in cloth bundles, and used for massaging specific body parts along with herbal steam.

content.overview: A specialized therapy using medicinal rice preparations in cloth pouches for neuromuscular rehabilitation.
content.procedure: Shashtika rice cooked with herbal decoctions and milk is tied in cloth boluses, heated, and used for massaging affected areas.

content.overview: An unique therapy using chicken meat preparations for deep tissue healing and strength restoration.
content.procedure: Specially prepared chicken meat is wrapped in cloth, heated with medicated oils, and used for therapeutic massage on affected areas.

content.overview: A specialized therapy using medicated meat preparations for deep tissue nourishment and musculoskeletal repair.
content.procedure: Medicated meat is cooked with herbal decoctions, wrapped in cloth, and used as warm boluses for therapeutic massage on affected areas.

content.overview: Topical application of medicinal herbal pastes for localized treatment of various conditions.
content.procedure: Herbs are ground into paste with liquids like milk/honey/water and applied evenly on affected areas. Left to dry before removal.

content.overview: Application of medicated herbal paste or oils on the crown of the head for neurological benefits.
content.procedure: A circular dough dam is created on the scalp, filled with warm medicated oil/herbal paste, and left to absorb.

content.overview: Therapeutic application of herbal pastes on the entire head for neurological and dermatological benefits.
content.procedure: Medicated herbal paste is applied evenly across the scalp and forehead, left to dry before washing with herbal water.

title: Udvartana
description: Herbal powder massage for weight management

content.overview: A vigorous upward massage using medicinal herbal powders to break down fat deposits and improve metabolism.
content.procedure: Therapists perform deep massage with dry/herbal-oil mixed powders using specific upward strokes on the body.

content.overview: Application of warm medicated poultices for deep tissue penetration of herbal properties.
content.procedure: Herbal paste is wrapped in cloth, heated, and tied over affected joints/muscles with bandages.

content.overview: Targeted application of medicinal pastes on specific marma points or affected areas.
content.procedure: Specific herbal formulations are applied precisely on marma points or injured areas following Ayurvedic protocols.

content.overview: A specialized eye treatment using medicated ghee to nourish and strengthen the eyes.
content.procedure: A dough dam is created around the eyes, filled with medicated ghee, and kept for a specific duration to nourish the eyes.

title: Basti
description: Medicated enema therapy for colon health

content.overview: Vasti is the most important Panchakarma therapy, administering herbal decoctions/oils through the rectal route to balance Vata dosha.
content.procedure:
Two main types:
1. Niruha Vasti (herbal decoction enema)
2. Anuvasana Vasti (oil enema)
Administered in series after proper preparation

content.overview: A type of medicated enema using herbal decoctions to cleanse and balance the colon.
content.procedure: A herbal decoction is prepared and administered as a medicated enema under the supervision of an Ayurvedic practitioner.

content.overview: A therapeutic enema using medicated oils to nourish and lubricate the colon.
content.procedure: Warm medicated oil is administered as an enema and retained for a specific duration to allow absorption.

content.overview: A specialized treatment where medicated oil is retained on the head to nourish the brain and nervous system.
content.procedure: A leather cap is fitted on the head, filled with warm medicated oil, and retained for a specific duration.

content.overview: A localized treatment where medicated oil is retained on the neck to relieve stiffness and pain.
content.procedure: A dough dam is created around the neck, filled with warm medicated oil, and retained for a specific duration.

content.overview: A localized treatment where medicated oil is retained on the lower back to relieve pain and stiffness.
content.procedure: A dough dam is created on the lower back, filled with warm medicated oil, and retained for a specific duration.

content.overview: A targeted treatment where medicated oil is retained on specific joints or body parts.
content.procedure: A dough dam is created around the affected joint, filled with warm medicated oil, and retained for a specific duration.

content.overview: A localized treatment where medicated oil is retained on the knee joint to improve mobility and reduce pain.
content.procedure: A dough dam is created around the knee, filled with warm medicated oil, and retained for therapeutic absorption.

content.overview: A targeted treatment creating temporary oil reservoirs on specific body parts for deep tissue nourishment.
content.procedure: Dough walls are built around the treatment area, filled with warm medicated oil, and maintained for absorption.

content.overview: A cleansing enema combining herbal decoctions and animal products for severe Vata disorders.
content.procedure: A complex preparation of herbal decoctions, honey, rock salt, and ghee administered as an enema.

content.overview: A specialized enema administered through the urethral/vaginal route for reproductive and urinary health.
content.procedure: Medicated oils/decoctions are gently administered through the urethra/vagina using specialized equipment.

content.overview: A Panchakarma procedure to eliminate excess Kapha dosha through medically induced vomiting.
content.procedure: After preparatory oleation and sudation, emetic herbs are administered under supervision to induce controlled vomiting.

content.overview: A Panchakarma procedure to cleanse the gastrointestinal tract through controlled purgation.
content.procedure: After preparatory therapies, purgative herbs are administered to induce controlled bowel elimination.

content.overview: Administration of medicated oils/powders through nasal passages for head-neck disorders.
content.procedure: Medicated substances are instilled into nostrils after facial massage and steam inhalation.

content.overview: A controlled blood purification procedure to remove toxins from the bloodstream.
content.procedure: Performed using leeches, venipuncture, or pricking methods under strict medical supervision.

content.overview: Use of medicinal leeches for blood purification and localized toxin removal.
content.procedure: Sterile medicinal leeches are applied to affected areas to draw out impure blood.

content.overview: A bloodletting technique using multiple superficial skin punctures for localized detoxification.
content.procedure: Multiple tiny pricks are made on affected skin using a special needle, followed by medicated pastes.

content.overview: Strategic vein puncture for blood purification and toxin removal.
content.procedure: Specific veins are punctured under strict aseptic conditions to remove impure blood.

content.overview: Controlled heat application using metallic probes for pain management and tissue repair.
content.procedure: Heated metal rods are briefly applied to precise points after local anesthesia.

content.overview: Continuous pouring of medicated milk over the body or forehead for nervous system nourishment.
content.procedure: Warm medicated milk is poured in a continuous stream using a special vessel from a fixed height.

content.overview: Therapeutic pouring of fermented medicated buttermilk for digestive and neurological benefits.
content.procedure: Medicated buttermilk is poured in rhythmic streams over the forehead or body.

content.overview: Continuous pouring of warm oil on the forehead to induce deep relaxation and neurological balance.
content.procedure: A steady stream of warm medicated oil is poured on the forehead from a suspended vessel.

content.overview: Gentle cleansing of vaginal tract using medicated liquids for gynecological health.
content.procedure: Warm herbal decoctions are used for vaginal irrigation under clinical supervision.

content.overview: Application of medicated cotton tampons for localized vaginal treatment.
content.procedure: Medicated cotton swabs soaked in herbal oils are inserted into the vaginal canal.

content.overview: Retention of medicated oils in vaginal canal for deep tissue nourishment.
content.procedure: Medicated oils are retained in the vaginal canal using a specially designed apparatus.

content.overview: Gentle eye irrigation with medicated liquids for ocular health maintenance.
content.procedure: Medicated decoctions are poured over open eyes using a special vessel.

content.overview: Application of medicinal eye salves for ocular health and vision improvement.
content.procedure: Medicated collyrium is applied along the eyelid margins using a sterile rod.

content.overview: Continuous flow of medicated liquid over closed eyelids to soothe and cleanse the eyes.
content.procedure: A steady stream of cooled herbal decoction is poured over closed eyes using a special vessel.

content.overview: Application of medicated herbal drops directly into the eyes for therapeutic benefits.
content.procedure: Sterile herbal juices or medicated oils are instilled into the eyes using a dropper.

content.overview: Placement of oil-soaked cotton pads on strategic points of the scalp for neurological benefits.
content.procedure: Cotton pads soaked in medicated oils are placed on the scalp and covered with a cloth.

content.overview: Inhalation of herbal smoke to cleanse respiratory channels and enhance mental clarity.
content.procedure: Herbs are burned in a dhumavarti (herbal cigar), and smoke is inhaled through nostrils.

content.overview: Holistic management of ocular health through specialized therapies like Netra Dhara, Anjana, and Vidalak.
content.procedure: Combination of internal medications, dietary guidelines, and external treatments tailored to specific conditions.
